title: Namibia and Zimbabwe qualify for ICC Men’s T20 World Cup 2026
byline: Namibia and Zimbabwe have secured their places in the 20-team ICC Men’s T20 World Cup 2026 in India and Sri Lanka.

title: Smith and spinners send England to big win over South Africa
byline: Linsey Smith and England’s spinners put South Africa to the sword in a comprehensive 10-wicket victory.

title: Weekend Sports Action for Sri Lankans: Premier League Blockbusters, Women’s World Cup Thrills, and the Singapore Grand Prix
byline: Sri Lankan sports fans are in for a blockbuster weekend as football, cricket, and Formula One combine to deliver non-stop action. From the Premier League’s heavyweight clashes to the ICC Women’s World Cup in Colombo and the Singapore Grand Prix under the lights, it’s a weekend guaranteed to keep fans glued to their screens and stadiums buzzing.

title: Chinese EXIM Bank increases interest rate from 2.5 per cent to 3.5 per cent
byline: The Committee on Public Finance (COPF) which said that EXIM Bank of China had increased the interest rate from the initially agreed 2.5 per cent to 3.5 per cent for the loan extended to finance the Kadawatha -Mirigama stretch of Central Express Way, requested the government to re-negotiate it.

title: Sri Lanka Women look to end Australia’s unbeaten streak
byline: Sri Lanka Women will be looking to bounce back when they face defending champions Australia in their second ICC Women’s World Cup 2025 match at the R. Premadasa Stadium in Colombo on Saturday.

title: Govt out to abolish Aswesuma: Sajith alleges
byline: The Government is out to abolish the Aswesuma social security programme soon, Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa said today.

title: Trump to Israel: ‘Stop Bombing Gaza’; Hamas agrees to release hostages
byline: The US leader had earlier warned he would unleash ’’all hell’’ if Hamas did not respond to his proposals.

title: China, U.S. Japan show interest in petroleum refinery in Sri Lanka
byline: Twenty foreign companies, including those from China, the United States (U.S.), and Japan, have expressed interest in investing in the expansion of Sri Lanka’s Sapugaskanda oil refinery, an official said yesterday.

title: ZeroPlastic Movement demands Rs.10 minimum price for plastic bags, cites flaw in new regulation
byline: The ZeroPlastic Movement is calling on the government to impose a minimum price of at least Rs.10 on all plastic shopping bags, warning that a new gazette set to take effect on November 1, 2025 may fail to reduce plastic pollution, due to a significant loophole.

title: Domestic flights with 70-seater aircraft could take off in six months- Peter Hill
byline: Sri Lanka could see the launch of a scheduled domestic airline service using 50-70-seater aircraft within the next six months, a move that could solve a long-standing barrier to tourism growth, according to aviation veteran and former SriLankan Airlines CEO Peter Hill.

title: World Bank team engages in high-level consultations with key finance oversight committees of Parliament of Sri Lanka
byline: A World Bank team, led by Country Manager Gevorg Sargsyan, held a consultation meeting on September 25, 2025 with Committee on Public Finance Chair Dr. Harsha de Silva and its members.

title: MR returns his bulletproof vehicle
byline: The bulletproof vehicle provided by the government to former President Mahinda Rajapaksa has been retuned, his media spokesman Manoj Gamage said.

title: Over 8,000 child-related complaints reported: NCPA
byline: The National Child Protection Authority (NCPA) said that over 8,000 complaints related to children have been reported from across the country.

title: Sanae Takaichi set to become Japan’s first female prime minister
byline: Japan’s ruling conservative party has elected Sanae Takaichi as its new leader, positioning the 64-year-old to be Japan’s first female prime minister.

title: One injured in lorry-train collision
byline: One person was seriously injured when a lorry collided with the Beliatta bound train from Maradana at the Kabalana railway crossing in Ahangama this morning.

title: Tunisian sentenced to death for Facebook posts criticising president
byline: A Tunisian man has been sentenced to death on charges of insulting the president and assaulting state security through posts on social media, the head of the Tunisian League for Human Rights and his lawyer said on Friday.

title: Bribery Commission cracks down on hidden assets under new crime act
byline: The Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) is probing several properties, including a hotel and multiple houses connected to public officials, under Sri Lanka’s new Proceeds of Crime Act, Director General Ranga Dissanayake said.

title: Fresh probes on Thajudeen launched based on Manamperi’s disclosures: Nalinda
byline: Fresh investigations into the death of ruggerite Wasim Thajudeen have been launched based on the disclosures made by Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) local politician Sampath Manamperi, who was remanded over a drug case, Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa said yesterday.

title: Government refutes increase in President’s expenses for 2026
byline: The Finance Ministry refuted certain media reports on the President’s expenditure head in the Appropriation Bill for 2026 which claimed that the President’s expenditures had gone up by three times.
